name: Loom
one_liner: Cloud storage for photos and videos (acquired by Dropbox).

name: Ark
long_description:
Ark.com is a search engine for people. With Ark, you can search for new people, old classmates, new business contacts, and even your friends. With over a billion social network profiles indexed, and using a modern architecture, Ark provided the most comprehensive people search engine in the world.

Prior to founding Ark, our team has experience at Google, AOL, Symantec, Lithium, Yahoo! Research and Y-Combinator.
one_liner: Ark organizes the world's social information.

name: Upbeat
long_description:
Upbeat is a software-powered next-generation PR agency that focuses on media marketing for various companies. The company is a team of software engineers and PR professionals working together to bring the old-school PR industry to the modern world.

Upbeat turns story ideas to into something presentable by connecting the best stories to the best storytellers. They also manage email outreach and follow-ups and keep track of pitch's progress with real-time analytics and email updates. And, its software is also an avenue to monitor media opportunities on company's behalf.
one_liner: Upbeat: Building the next generation of Public Relations (PR)

name: All Screen
long_description: 140Fire is the fastest growing online video ad network. Brands and agencies utilize 140Fire for it's suite of engagement and data tools which make media buying 10x more effective when it comes to running video ads. Backed by Y Combinator, Mark Cuban, Jonathan Kraft and Skip Paul, 140Fire is based in Santa Monica and has 15 employees.
one_liner: Connecting users with engaging video content across the web.â€¦

name: LaunchHear
long_description: LaunchHear is a way for bloggers to get early review copies of new products.
one_liner: LaunchHear was a startup attempting to make PR scale in the same wayâ€¦

name: Slinkset
long_description: Slinkset is a white label social news platform that allows anyone to start a social news site and integrate it into their own website.
one_liner: Votable lists

name: Omnisio
long_description:
Omnisio was founded in 2007 by Ryan Junee, Simon Ratner and Julian Frumar, and was subsquently acquired by YouTube in July 2008. Omnisio enabled users to annotate and share videos from any website, and enabled markup of the structure within a video.

On May 13, 2008, Omnisio launched a slide-syncing tool using SlideShare for slides and a host of video services.
one_liner: Edit and enhance online video. Acquired by Google in July 2008.

name: ZumoDrive
one_liner: Media in the cloud

name: Snipshot
long_description: Snipshot is a photo editor that lets you start editing any photo with one click of a bookmarklet. You can use Snipshot to crop, resize, adjust colors, an automatically enhance you photos within your browser and then save it back to the web. There are a couple other photo editors in this category and Photoshop plans to get in as well.
one_liner: We sold Snipshot to Ansa in 2013.

name: Everyday.me
long_description: Everyday.me is an automatic journal that helps you to record your life and store it forever.
one_liner: Everyday.me - Record your life.  Store it forever.

name: Svbtle
long_description: A publishing platform designed to work the same way your brain does.
one_liner: A publishing platform.

name: Vidpresso
long_description: Media companies, brands and celebrities used Vidpresso to create the best quality live videos, typically for Facebook Live and Twitter. Vidpresso was acquired in 2018 by Facebook.
one_liner: Help media companies make quality live video. [Acquired by Facebook]

name: Product Hunt
long_description:
Product Hunt surfaces the best new products, every day. It's a place for product-loving enthusiasts to share and geek out about the latest mobile apps, websites, hardware projects, and tech creations. 

Community members can submit, browse, vote and comment on daily submissions of products and collections of products. They also get the opportunity to interact directly with product creators, investors, journalists, as well as, an active community of people who are passionate about products.
one_liner: The best new products in tech

name: Tech in Asia
long_description: Tech in Asia (YC W15) is the largest English-language technology media company that focuses on Asia. From the latest news to the hottest trends and the boldest startups to the strongest titans, we cover everything tech in the region. Our goal is to build and serve Asiaâ€™s tech and startup community.
one_liner: Tech in Asia (YC W15) is the largest English-language technologyâ€¦

name: Blitz Esports
long_description:
Blitz Esports is a tech and media startup focused on bridging the gap between esports fandom and personal gameplay. We're one of the premier media publications in esports, specializing in educational video content for League of Legends, CS:GO and Overwatch.

We've also developed the first fully automatic League of Legends coaching app, which uses computer vision and data-driven insights to proactively help gamers make better decisions at each step of their gameplay experience. A month into open beta, the Blitz app is now used in over a million games each week.
one_liner: Blitz breaks down the complex world of esports and offers newâ€¦

name: Joy
all_locations: San Francisco, CA, USA; New York, NY, USA; Austin, TX, USA; Remote
long_description: Joy is a software platform with a mission to help the world celebrate better together. Our software helps everyone plan and remember all of life's events. Big or small, Joy is there every step of the way.
one_liner: The platform for all your life events.

name: The Athletic
long_description: The Athletic is a direct-to-consumer digital sports media company committed to helping subscribers experience storytelling in a whole new way. Founded in 2016 and headquartered in San Francisco, The Athletic has over 600 full-time employees and covers more than 250 professional sports and collegiate teams in the US, Canada and the UK. The Athleticâ€™s newsroom has produced thousands of in-depth articles along with more than 120 podcasts and premium video content. The Athletic is a remote-friendly company as we have offices in San Francisco, Los Angeles, London, and Melbourne.
one_liner: Subscription sports media.

name: Breaker
long_description:
Breaker is a podcast listening and discovery application.

Most podcasts are free, but serious publishers are spending big budgets to make high quality audio content like Serial, which hit 100 million downloads and made podcasts mainstream. 67 million Americans are already listening to podcasts a month. Breaker wants to sign exclusive deals to distribute the best premium podcasts and charge users $6 per month. First, its goal is to build a huge listener audience by making the best podcast consumption app. It launched today, and will offer podcasters ways to connect and get feedback from their community, and analytics about what content performs best. It has a stunning 67% retention rate after a month for beta users. If it can convince people to pay for whatâ€™s often free, it could become the preferred place for podcasters to talk.
one_liner: A podcast company.

name: Audm
long_description: Audm is a mobile app that turns long-form print journalism into professionally narrated digital audio. The app, which was quietly launched on 2016, uses professional voice actors to read news content that makes it enjoyable to listen to.
one_liner: Audm is a subscription service providing mini-audiobooks â€”â€¦

name: Demeanor.co
one_liner: Now part of thentwrk.com

name: Ixora
one_liner: We create the digital outdoor environment for a movie.

name: MoFE
long_description: Museum of Future Experiences (MoFE) is a media tech company that creates, publishes and distributes high end immersive VR experiences.
one_liner: Next generation Disney.

name: Plotdrive
long_description:
Plotdrive is the first continuous production system for narrative â€” infrastructure that transforms how long-form stories move from imagination to completion. Most books donâ€™t fail for lack of talent; they fail when the workflow collapses somewhere between page 80 and page 300.

Founded by brothers with backgrounds in high-stakes poker, VR, and narrative systems, we built what we couldnâ€™t find: an engine that holds the entire shape of a story while authors work inside it. Writers see 4â€“5Ã— gains in throughput without losing their voice. Manuscripts that sat untouched for years finally reach the finish line. Authors are using Plotdrive to break decade-long blocks. Publishers are using it to rethink how story pipelines should operate when continuity, context, and editorial craft can finally scale.

The printing press made distribution industrial. Weâ€™re making completion industrial â€” creating the foundational layer for how narrative gets made at scale.
one_liner: AI that remembers your book and helps you finish it

name: Demand Curve
long_description:
Demand Curve is your startup's growth operating system, the lowest risk, fastest path to getting traction and growing your company.

ðŸš€ Growth Program: A membership/course designed for startup operators who want to learn and execute growth without hiring a full team yet. Powered by our premium content library, expert guidance, and AI growth co-pilot, it's a step-by-step guide to building a growth engine that actually works. Trusted by 3,000+ startups (including over 500 YC companies).

ðŸ“° Newsletter: We also publish the Growth Newsletter, reaching 100,000+ founders and marketers every week with strategic and tactical growth advice. It's one of the most-read startup growth newsletters with 46-50% open rates.

name: Eternal
one_liner: Own the best moments in streaming

name: Gigs Live
long_description: We are the Substack for millions of artists, musicians, indie producers, extreme sports athletes and video production companies. With us, creators have the freedom to choose flexible monetization plans such as PPV, micro-subscriptions, merch drops and many more.   Creators choose us because our platform is available in 4K on Apple TV, Roku, Amazon Fire, Gaming consoles and more. Creators also get audience analytics and marketing to retain and acquire their audience. So take care of marketing, distribution and monetization for creators so they can focus on their craft and we take care of the rest.
one_liner: Video publishing and monetization platform for creators and artists

name: True3D Labs
long_description:
True3D is building the next generation of video.
Our AI foundation models bring real-world depth to every frame, making 3D creation and streaming instant and universal.
one_liner: AI models for 3D video creation and playback

name: Litnerd
long_description:
Litnerd is a kids reading + writing club app that grew by 14x this past school year. Think of us as a modern-day Scholastic, with a heavy IP play. We create original IP with our community + partner brands -> turn them into books, media and learning curriculum, layered with an AI personalized tutor to help kids learn to read and write in a personalized and engaging way.

Our product format is a Social and Gamified - with a live weekly community meetup and monthly e-tournaments. 

- And it works! Litnerd 4x improved the pass rate of students on their annual state Reading (ELA) exam.
- STICKY: Kids spend 10-20 minutes on the Litnerd app OUTSIDE of classroom time.
- KID AUTHORS: Kids are the authors of the books and Litnerd AI helps illustrate + publish the book.
- Built on the Science of Reading
- Original IP: all books, media and courseware is original content created and published by Litnerd.
one_liner: Reading + Writing Club App for Kids

name: Boardcave
long_description: The one stop shop for surfers. Boardcave provides surfers with online surf knowledge and gear to accelerate their surfing. The company is reimagining how surfers progress and partake in ocean activities.
one_liner: Building the worldâ€™s largest online surf gear store.

name: coil inc.
one_liner: ai

name: Storyboarder
long_description:
Storyboarder is a tool and a platform for anyone to create, share, and sell webcomics.


In East Asia, the webcomic (or digital manga) industry is an $12B market and rapidly growing to the rest of the world. Webtoon, the largest company in the space, generates $100M / month in revenue. However, their addressable market is limited by their content creators, who need know how to draw.Â Readers are desperate for a greater variety of stories in webcomics.


Through years of working with filmmakers, weâ€™ve built extremely easy to use storyboarding software  that has 700K users. Weâ€™re democratizing visual storytelling to everyone. Weâ€™re working on the next generation that, through advances in video game interfaces, ubiquitous 3D compute, and AI, will allow anyone to easily create scenes, pose characters, to create webcomics. 


Storyboarder is backed by Y Combinator (W23), David Karp (Tumblr Founder), Andrew Kortina (Venmo Founder), and other product focused investors.
one_liner: Tool and platform to create and sell webcomics

name: Shortbread
long_description: Shortbread app is Netflix for romance comics built by a team of women writers, artists and engineers. We work with bestselling authors on Kindle and #BookTok to turn their romance fictions into comics. Our content specialize in viral romance fiction tropes such as mafia and dark romance. The comics are free to read with options to buy a subscription.
one_liner: Read romance comics.

name: SuperCraft
long_description:
SuperCraft is a generative AI software for teams building physical products

We help businesses securely use generative AI capabilities across their design departments for faster design exploration and visualization of physical products

Fortune 500 companies are using SuperCraft to create new product designs, and visualize how their product will look like in a real scenario, before actually building it, and treat the design boards as a shared source of truth that all teams involved can collaborate and provide feedback on - resulting in faster design reviews, more creative exploration, and faster time to market.
one_liner: Figma for designing physical products

name: Kite
long_description:
Kite is a screen recorder that makes your demo videos look like Apple commercials in minutes.

Simply record your app (works for iPhone recordings too!). Kite will track your cursor and keyboard inputs, so it can automatically zoom in on the action with professional 3D animations.

Kite is as easy as Canva, but your videos will look like they came out of OpenAI or Figma.

- One-click cinematic 3D animations
- Display recordings on 3D mockup devices (MacBooks, iPhones etc)
- Combine unlimited recordings into one video
- Edit, adjust speed and trim recordings
- Add text scenes and text annotations alongside recordings
- AI voiceovers using state of the art text to speech models
- Free music library
- Brand kitâ€“upload your logos, colors and fonts
- Start from our template library or start from scratch

Kite is used by hundreds of YC companies for launch videos, social media posts, landing page demos, changelog updates, feature releases and more.
one_liner: Screen recorder for stunning product demo videos

name: Magic Hour
long_description:
Magic Hour is a professional video creation tool. 

It takes the best AI video models, puts them in one workflow, and makes creating an amazing video as easy as selecting a template and customizing it.

You can use the product at https://magichour.ai
one_liner: Platform for AI video generation.

name: Comfy Deploy
long_description:
ComfyUI is the most popular open-source framework to build media generation workflows. However, it's a single-player experience that needs to run on a local GPU. Everyone has different environments and sharing workflows to someone else can take days to get setup.

Comfy Deploy fixes this by creating a collaborative workspace, where a teams environemnt, models and workflows can be shared as easily with a link.

**Team ComfyUI workspace**

â€¢ Replacing cobbled-together solutions with a unified, team-focused environment. When it works for you, you can be sure it works for your team.

â€¢ Eliminate "works on my machine" issues with version control.

â€¢ Share storage for models and outputs.

â€¢ Leverage the power of ComfyUI without the complexities of self-hosting

**Powerful GPU Infrastructure**
â€¢ Access managed GPUs that grow with your teams needs

â€¢ Tailor the platform to your requirements by easily installing custom nodes and models


**Custom configuration**

â€¢ Download the models you want, stored privately in your personal volume

â€¢ Install the custom nodes your workflow needs

â€¢ Train models on your own datasets.


**API Deployments: From workflow to production in seconds**

â€¢ Transform any workflow into a fully functional API immediately without extra engineering

â€¢ Comprehensive observability on every run

â€¢ Built-in API authentication

â€¢ TS/JS/Python/Ruby SDKs for seamless integration
one_liner: ComfyUI for everyone on your team

name: Capitol AI
long_description:
Capitol builds intelligence infrastructure for companies overwhelmed by data but starved for clarity. Today, 80% of enterprise AI projects fail because outputs aren't accurate, attributable, or usable. Capitol AI works with companies in high-stakes industries to turn information into intelligence that drives decisions with model-agnostic, purpose-built infrastructure. 

Capitol is building a different future - one where institutions, creators, and analysts stay in control of their knowledge, their IP, and their value. We deliver a model-agnostic platform that turns complexity into decision-grade insight. We don't believe the future should be dictated by a handful of closed models. We enforce attribution, minimize hallucinations, and preserve temporal accuracy - giving companies trusted answers they can act on.
one_liner: Model-agnostic AI for enterprises: governed, embedded, decision-grade.

name: Overlap
long_description:
Overlap builds multimodal AI agents that can do literally anything you want related to video, such as finding specific moments, generating clips, or analyzing your video library. 

What takes media companies thousands of hours, we do in seconds.
one_liner: Multimodal AI agents for video

name: Darkgrade
long_description: We're building a protocol for large language models to directly interface with image sensors.
one_liner: Let your camera understand the world

name: Diffusion Studio
long_description: Diffusion Studio Pro is a browser based non-linear editor (NLE) that uses WebCodecs and WebGPU to deliver smooth, pro level performance. It brings the modern UX of tools like Figma and Framer to video editing, making it easy for anyone to create professional content.
one_liner: Professional-grade video editing, in your browser.

name: Prism
one_liner: Short form video ads

name: The Interface
long_description: The Interface enables anyone to create, interact, and share on the fly â€” from TV shows to games to movies. Drawing on deep expertise in realtime compute and simulation, we combine multimodal AI with the best of 3D simulation and modelling techniques, to deliver real-time experiences that are alive, interactive, and emergent.
one_liner: The foundations for AI-native media

name: Aspect
long_description:
With our visual understanding engine & platform, Aspect data teams at AI labs.

Aspect processes dense multimodal datasets, providing tools for segmentation, QC, structured schema extraction. 

Companies today have access to Glean and Notion Agents for working with vast text corpuses - Aspect is enabling that for multimodal data.
one_liner: AI Visual Understanding for Multimodal Data

name: Koyal
long_description:
Koyal is an Agentic AI Filmmaking Platform that allows you to seamlessly convert script or audio into personalized, visually compelling stories. Weâ€™re a team from Carnegie Mellon, MIT and Meta, with experience in AI video generation.

https://koyal.ai builds directly upon our published research at the AI conference NeurIPS in December. Weâ€™ve been covered in the international press for our patented secure personalization protocol CHARCHA: the genAI captcha.

Announcement: https://x.com/meh_agarwal/status/1965866965425348687
Demo: https://x.com/meh_agarwal/status/1965137062119752099


We currently have paid pilots with the biggest global music labels, podcasts and production houses, and just launched our public beta at beta.koyal.ai

We recently concluded a pilot with Universal Music and T-Series (worldâ€™s largest music label) alongside Bollywood production houses like Maddock Entertainment, and Collective Artists Network! As part of that, we launched 5 music videos for Grammy and Oscar winning artists like A R Rahman, Ricky Kej and Shankar Mahadevan all crossing 1.5 million views!

We've recently built SOTA capabilities in (i) multilingual script to audio to video, (ii) Agentic lip-sync with dynamic movement & (iii) Multi-character consistency.
one_liner: Agentic AI Filmmaking Platform

name: Velvet
long_description: The platform where frontier research labs buy data for world models.
one_liner: Data for world models

name: Cardboard
long_description:
Cardboard is an agentic video editor for growth/marketing teams and serious creators who need to ship videos consistently. Instead of agencies, long timelines, and infinite review cycles, teams give cardboard a footage + a goal (â€œ3 variantsâ€, â€œ30s hookâ€, â€œtestimonialsâ€) to get a strong first cut in minutes on which they can iterate quickly.

Multimodal LLMs can finally reason over footage, and WebGPU/WebCodecs make a real NLE possible in the browser. For the first time, an â€œAI directorâ€ inside a professional editor can be a reality.

We have to build two hard things at once: a high-performance editor in the browser and an agentic editor that is reliable for production use cases. Most startups do one; incumbents canâ€™t rebuild their stack without breaking everything.

Saksham and Ishan met in school and have known each other since 15 years. Saksham was Co-founder/CTO of Iterate AI (backed by EF) and posts content on social media; Ishan has spent ~5yr building memory-heavy, performance-critical browser apps at HackerRank (S11) and deeply understands browsers. He has built Hotspoter (5M+ downloads) when he was 14.

Together, weâ€™re unusually suited to build the editor core others avoid.

Video is becoming the default distribution channel, and the team that iterates fastest compounds attention. Cardboard becomes the default workspace for video production, the way Canva/Figma became the workspace for design - because itâ€™s collaborative, fast, and does the tedious parts for you.
one_liner: Agentic video editor
